ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] questions about WARC format
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with Steve s comments and opinions, and with regards to having a payload digest in the WARC header: it makes sense to me because calculating a payload

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] questions about WARC format
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=328015130; y=6ahPga0DAQos6fn6aYUaqYHsFSPcYaez4ODcD2snY-fE
X-Yahoo-Profile: asbinn


I agree with Steve's comments and opinions, and with regards to having a
payload digest in the WARC header: it makes sense to me because
calculating a payload digest can be an expensive operation.  Consider
using a SHA-512 algorithm on a harvested YouTube video.

In contrast, sniffing the first few kilobytes of the response to find an
HTTP Content-Type header isn't that expensive.


Aaron

-- 
Aaron Binns
Senior Software Engineer, Web Group, Internet Archive
Program Officer, IIPC
